oai_dc:dc.dc:title: GEOMETRY EVALUATING PIECEWISE LINEAR INTERFACE COMPUTATION (GE-PLIC) TAILORED TO THE NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF BREAKING WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Knoblauch, Fabian
Soydan, Ahmet
Wang, Widar Weizhi
Bihs, Hans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Dynamics of breaking waves are generally of significant interest for coastal engineering disciplines, since they result in considerable slamming forces on structures (Kamath et al., 2016). A key point for the accurate modelling of breaking waves is the representation of the free surface. Especially over-topping breaking waves put high demands on the capabilities of the free surface representation method, due to their complex geometries and features such as air cavities and reconnecting surfaces.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; waves.95
